properties.otherAdvice: The Cowra Carnival of Cups will be held on Sunday 12 November at the Cowra showground. There will be speed reduction, no parking zones and stop slow traffic on the Mid Western Highway (Grenfell Road)

A-League Double Header: Newcastle Jets v Western Sydney Wanderers at McDonald Jones Stadium. Men's match from 3pm and Women's match from 5:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney – Sydney Streets on Harris Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Harris St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place between 9am and 11:30pm on:

  • Harris St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and John St
  • Miller St between Little Mount St and Harris St
  • Miller St between Saunders St and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union St between Harris St and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders St between exit of Saunders St and Miller St (eastbound)

Motorists will be detoured via Pyrmont St and John St.

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Harris St and Miller St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Miller Street between Little Mount Street and Harris Street

  • Union Street between Harris Street and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders Street 3 between exit of Saunders Street and Miller Street (eastbound)

1. Resident Access between John St and Union Square under traffic control

2. Resident Access Permitted

Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Route 311 buses will be diverting around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 9pm.

Road closures:

  • From 9am to 11:30pm: Darlinghurst Rd will be closed between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St. Sections of Macleay St, Orwell St and Roslyn St will also close.
  • Motorists will be detoured via Greenknowe Ave, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Ward Ave, Bayswater Rd or Craigend St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and Roslyn St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 20 October to Monday 6 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads will close from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 20 October until 10am Monday 6 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways:

Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 October, and Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd from Oxford St at Bondi Junction to Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 8pm: Bondi Rd from Sandridge St at Bondi Beach to Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (southern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BRONTE, TAMARAMA & BONDI

7:30AM TO 6:30PM DAILY FROM FRIDAY 20 OCTOBER TO MONDAY 6 NOVEMBER 2023

Access will be maintained for residents and taxis only

  • Ashley St between Turner St and end of lane
  • Bayview St between West of Bronte Marine Drive and end of street
  • Birrell St between Tamarama St and Cross St (Eastbound lanes only)
  • Carlisle St between Dellview St and end of street
  • Cross St between Birrell St and Turner St (Southbound lanes only)

ONE WAY CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS

The following roads will become one-way only roads for the duration of the event:

From 9am, Fri 20 Oct until 10am, Mon 6 Nov:

  • Ashley St from Darling St to Turner St (northbound only)
  • Birrell St from Cross St to Tamarama St (westbound only)
  • Cross St from Turner St to Birrell St (northbound only)

  • Thompson St from Mirimar Ave to Ashley St (westbound only)
  • Turner St from Ashley St to Cross St (westbound only)
  • Marks Ln from Fletcher St to Kenneth St (southbound only)

From 10am, Fri 20 Oct until 10am, Mon 6 Nov:

  • Dellview St from Pacific Ave to Fletcher St (northbound only)
  • Gaerloch Ave from Alexander St to Pacific Ave (southbound only)

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for ticketholders. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Melbourne Cup Day – Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11:45am, last race at 6:05pm and concert from 6:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Def Leppard and Mötley Crüe at GIANTS Stadium. Show starts from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd as crowds travel to and from the concert.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Attendees are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event or until sold out

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ladies Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:20pm, last race from 6:10pm and concert from 6:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

NBL & WNBL Double Header at Qudos Bank Arena. Sydney Flames v Melbourne Boomers in the WNBL from 1:30pm and Sydney Kings v Brisbane Bullets tip-off from 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unles sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v New Zealand Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 4pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unles sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:25pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Supercross Championships Round 2 at McDonald Jones Stadium. Activations open 1pm and gates open at 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as attendees travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Music events at Fleet Steps in the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney.

  • Friday 17 November – 6pm to 10:30pm: Hot Dub on the Harbour
  • Saturday 18 November – 2pm to 10pm: Harbourlife
  • Sunday 19 November – 2pm to 10pm: Heaps Gay presents Wet Dreams

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to The Domain as attendees travel to the events. Traffic will be particularly heavy on Friday 17 November as attendees travel during the already busy Friday evening peak.

Sections of Mrs Macquaries Rd will be closed from 12:30pm Friday 17 November until 11:59pm Sunday 19 November to safely facilitate the events. A section of Art Gallery Rd will also be closed each night to allow attendees to safely leave the area.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time and watch out for pedestrians.

arrangementElements.html:
MRS MACQUARIES ROAD – NORTHERN LOOP

  • The Northern Loop will be closed at the turning circle from 12:30pm Friday 17 November until 11:59pm Sunday 19 November.

ART GALLERY ROAD & MRS MACQUARIES ROAD – SOUTHERN LOOP

Art Gallery Road and the Southern Loop of Mrs Macquaries Road will be closed for pedestrain safetly leaving each event:

  • Friday 17 November from 9:30pm to 11:30pm
  • Saturday 18 November from 8:30pm to 11:00pm
  • Sunday 19 November from 8:30pm to 11:00pm
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice: The Coffs Harbour Remembrance Day will be held on Saturday 11 November at 9am. Vernon Street will be closed between the Pacific Highway and Castle Street. There will be increased pedestrian activity in the area, as people make their way to and from the service.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via Castle Street and Coffs Street to get onto the Pacific Highway.

properties.otherAdvice: The Sparke Helmore Newcastle City Triathlon will be held on Sunday 12 November from 6am to 5pm. Exercise caution, as there will be increased pedestrian activity in the area, as people make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar at Industree Group Stadium. Women's kick off from 2:15pm and men's kick off at 5pm. FInish around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 12.45pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

webLinks.linkText: 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships

properties.otherAdvice: The 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships will be held from Thursday 9 November to Sunday 19 November. The public boat ramp off Dane Drive will be closed during the event. Please exercise caution, as there will be increased pedestrian activity in the area.
properties.displayName: 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Grenfell Remembrance Day Commemorative Service will be held on Saturday 11 November 2023 at the Grenfell Memorial Park located on the corner of Mid Western Highway (Camp Street) and Weddin Street.
properties.diversions: Traffic will be detoured via East Street, Young Street and Wood Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Part of the Monaro Hwy will be closed on 11 November from 10.30 am to 11.30 am for Remembrance Day commemorations.

Forbes St will be closed between Terry St and Maybe St.

Maybe St will be closed between Forbes St and Caveat St.
properties.diversions: Motorists can detour via Therry St and Caveat St.

properties.otherAdvice: The Multi-Cultural Street Event will be held on Saturday 11 November from 2pm to 9pm in Mayfield. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Robbie Williams live at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 8pm and finishes around 10:20pm.

With more than 35,000 fans significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park during the already busy Thursday night peak.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Fans are urged to catch public transport.

Road & Cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • The Moore Park Rd cycleway will be closed between Regent St and Oatley Rd outside the stadium from 4.30pm to midnight. Cyclists will be detoured via Gordon St, Renny St and Oatley Rd both directions. 
  • For the safe crowd bump out further closures will be in place on the Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway from Poate Rd to Bourke St from 10.30pm to midnight. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm until midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The Rhododendron Festival has been held annually since 1953. Whilst the festival includes various events, Rhodo Day Saturday 4 November will see a Grand Parade through the town along Wentworth St. Wentworth St will be closed from Hat Hill Rd to Prince George St and Leichardt St closed from the Great Western Hwy to Wentworth St from 10am to 12pm. Traffic control will be in place.
properties.diversions: Detours can be made via Prince George St or Hat Hill Road.

properties.publicTransport: Special charter buses will be running from Rouse Hill and Strathfield to Rosehill Gardens - just show your race day ticket to drivers when boarding services. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Golden Eagle Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:10pm, last race from 6pm and concert from 6:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Unitedat Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm, full time approx 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Riding Hearts Festival at Sydney Showground. Acts start from 3pm, finish by 10.45pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with large volumes of rideshare and taxi movements.

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.

Sam Smith – Gloria The Tour at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 3 and Saturday 4 November. Concert starts around 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct, particularly on Friday during the already busy evening peak.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses are diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways are in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown is closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson L, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers L are also closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways are in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
